definition: Takow, Takao or Takau, old name for Kaohsiung 高雄[Gao1 xiong2] in the southwest of Taiwan
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to beat a dog and bully its owner/fig. to humiliate sb indirectly by bullying a subordinate
lit. when one beats a dog, one must answer to its master (idiom)/fig. before punishing sb, one should consider how that would affect others associated with him
pinyin: da3 gou3 hai2 dei3 kan4 zhu3 ren2

definition: what's gone can never come back

sentences.english: I saw some roughness throwing stones to any dog.
sentences.chinese: 我看見幾個男孩在擲石頭打狗。

sentences.english: The boys teased the dog by pebbling it with acorns.
sentences.chinese: 男孩子們用橡樹果打狗逗它玩。

sentences.english: I saw the naughty boy hitting the dog.
sentences.chinese: 我看見那個頑皮孩子打狗。

sentences.english: The boy tease the dog by pebble it with acorn .
sentences.chinese: 男孩子們用橡樹果打狗逗它玩。

sentences.english: A dog will not howl if you beat him with a bone.
The man hit the dog with a newspaper.
I saw some boys throwing stones at a dog.
sentences.chinese: 我看見幾個男孩在擲石頭打狗。

definition: lit. a dog who catches mice/to be meddlesome (idiom)
a dog threatens based on master's power (idiom); to use one's position to bully others
to take a beating/to get thrashed/to come under attack
to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about
to slap sb's face/to slap one's own face/fig. to fail to live up to a boast
lit. when one beats a dog, one must answer to its master (idiom)/fig. before punishing sb, one should consider how that would affect others associated with him
pinyin: da3 gou3 hai2 dei3 kan4 zhu3 ren2
